A 7-year-old boy with a history of renal dysplasia and chronic kidney disease is seen for a health supervision visit. He has a history of increased thirst and polyuria. His current medications include sodium bicarbonate, ferrous sulfate, calcium carbonate, and calcitriol. His weight is at the fifth percentile, and his height is at the third percentile. He has a heart rate of 89 beats/min, a respiratory rate of 16 breaths/min, and a blood pressure of 90/60 mm Hg. The rest of the examination findings are unremarkable. Of the following, the MOST appropriate dietary restriction for this child is

A 5-year-old boy with fever and rash is seen in the emergency department. Onset of fever was 4 days ago and associated with a runny nose, cough, and red eyes. One day before presentation, he developed a rash that started on the forehead and behind his ears and spread to the trunk and then the extremities. There are no known sick contacts, no pets at home, and no recent travel. He is unimmunized. The boy is irritable and has a temperature of 40°C, a heart rate of 126 beats/min, and a respiratory rate of 22 breaths/min. His blood pressure is normal. Physical examination findings are notable for nonpurulent conjunctivitis, pharyngeal erythema, and a generalized maculopapular rash over the head, trunk, and extremities. The remainder of the physical examination findings are unremarkable. Of the following, in addition to standard precautions, the MOST appropriate isolation precautions for this child are

A 7-year-old boy with cola-colored urine and decreased urine output of 1 day’s duration is brought to the emergency department. He has no history of fever, rash, diarrhea, vomiting, frequency, or burning with urination. He had a sore throat 2 weeks ago. He has a heart rate of 108 beats/min, a respiratory rate is 20 breaths/min, and a blood pressure of 130/90 mm Hg. He has swelling over his face and mild pitting edema of both lower extremities. His chest is clear to auscultation, and the rest of the examination findings are unremarkable. Laboratory data are shown: Blood Sodium 132 mEq/L (132 mmol/L) Potassium 5.0 mEq/L (5.0 mmol/L) Chloride 100 mEq/L (100 mmol/L) Bicarbonate 22 mEq/L (22 mmol/L) Blood urea nitrogen 28 mg/dL (10.0 mmol/L) Creatinine 1.8 mg/dL (159 μmol/L) Albumin 2.5 g/dL (25 g/L) Complement C3 - 16 mg/dL (0.16 g/L) (reference range, 85-142 mg/dL [0.85-1.42 g/L]) Complement C4 - 22 mg/dL (0.22 g/L) (reference range, 12-41 mg/dL [0.12-0.41 g/L]) Antistreptolysin O- 800 IU Urine- Blood 3+; Protein 3+ ;Red blood cells 50-100/HPF; White blood cells 5-10/HPF Of the following, the MOST appropriate treatment for this child is

questions.correct_answer: B. Removes antibody and adds ADAMTS

questions.text: A patient came to OPD and following was seen. Which is disgnosis?

Researchers are developing a vaccine to protect against a novel coronavirus infection. The virus spreads via droplet inhalation and enters respiratory epithelium using viral spike proteins. The researchers develop mRNA for the spike protein in vitro and formulate an mRNA vaccine that can be administered to susceptible individuals. The protective effect generated by this vaccine most likely involves which of the following mechanisms?

options.label: B
options.text: Expression of viral protein by antigen-presenting cells.

options.label: C
options.text: Formation of antibodies targeting viral mRNA.

options.label: D
options.text: Integration of viral mRNA into the host genome.

questions.correct_answer: B. Expression of viral protein by antigen-presenting cells.

questions.text: A 42-year-old PLHIV man comes to the emergency department with 3 days of abdominal pain, decreased appetite, and diarrhea. Temperature is 380 C, blood pressure is 98/60 mm Hg, and pulse is 110/min. Abdominal examination shows tenderness over the left lower quadrant without guarding or rebound tenderness. CD4 count is 38/mm3. Colonoscopy shows erythematous, friable mucosa with superficial ulcerations in the sigmoid and descending colon. Biopsy from the ulcers reveals inflammatory infiltrate, mucosal necrosis and enlarged endothelial cells with large, ovoid nuclei containing prominent basophilic deposits. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient’s gastrointestinal symptoms?

A 12-year-old boy is admitted to the hospital with a diagnosis of “pain of unknown origin.” His parents tell the physician that the child has complained about pain in his legs for about 1 month. Neurologic and orthopedic examinations fail to identify any pathology. The history reveals that the child was hospitalized on two previous occasions for other pain symptoms for which no cause was found. After 4 days in the hospital, the nurse reports that the child shows little evidence of pain and seems “remarkably content.” She also reports that she found a medical textbook in the boy’s bedside table with a bookmark in the section entitled “skeletal pain of unknown origin.” Which of the following best describes symptom production and motivation in this case?

options.text: Symptom production conscious, motivation primarily unconscious

A 27 yr old sexually active mail develops a vesiculobullous lesion on glans soon after taking tab paracetamol for fever. The lesion healed with hyperpigmentation. The most likely diagnosis

questions.text: Paprika sign during debridement is crucial in management which of the following condition?

options.label: B

questions.correct_answer: B. Calcitonin is the drug of choice

questions.text: If the feedback gain of a control system is -3.0, this means that the system is-

options.label: A
options.text: A negative feedback system capable of correcting 1/3 of the initial disturbance to the system

options.label: B
options.text: A negative feedback system capable of correcting 2/3 of the initial disturbance to the system

options.label: C
options.text: A negative feedback system capable of correcting 3/4 of the initial disturbance to the system

options.label: D
options.text: A positive feedback system capable of correcting 1/3 of the initial disturbance to the system

questions.correct_answer: C. A negative feedback system capable of correcting 3/4 of the initial disturbance to the system

questions.text: A 70-year-old man undergoes general anesthesia to remove a tumor from his colon. Within a few minutes following administration of a halogenated anesthetic, the patient develops muscle rigidity and a rectal temperature of 108°F. His heart rate is 105 beats/min and respiration rate is 27 breaths/min. Which of the following is most likely to be decreased in this patient compared with normal resting conditions?
Which condition at the A-V node will cause a decrease in heart rate?

A patient with cirrhosis experiences a doubling of his serum creatinine over a 6-month period after sustained heavy ingestion of a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) for his arthritis. Which of the following is the best explanation for his increased serum creatinine?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased efferent arteriolar resistance which reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR)

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased Bowman’s capsule pressure which reduced GFR

options.label: C
options.text: Increased afferent arteriolar resistance which reduced GFR

options.label: D
options.text: Increased glomerular capillary filtration coefficient which reduced GFR

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased afferent arteriolar resistance which reduced GFR

questions.text: A person’s normal TV is 400 ml with a dead space of 100 ml. The respiratory rate is 12 breaths/min. The person undergoes ventilation during surgery, and the VT is 700 with a rate of 12. What is the approximate alveolar PCO 2 for this person?

A 55-year-old male presents with weight loss, hemoptysis. Imaging shows a masa in the lungs with central necrotic areas. The biopsy from the mass shows sheets of cells, with pleomorphism, numerous mitotic counts, no Keratin pearls, squamous islands or glands were seen. The cells turned out to be positive for P40, P63. Which of the following is likely diagnosis?

A 25-year male is having discomfort in around knee while running. X ray shows a tumor arising from metaphysis with a bony stalk. There are no other symptoms. Excision of the lesion was done, and histology is as showing in the image. Likely diagnosis?

Routine screening of a 28 year primigravida at 14 weeks who has microcytic anemia with Hb 11, mcv 60, RBC 5 million, since she had history of thalassemia in one of her distant cousins, she also underwent Hb electrophoresis: Hb A95% HbA2 of 4.8%. husband doesn’t have any history of thalassemia in any members of the family. What is the next line of management?

Histology from a, endometrial mass in 55-year-old lady suspected of endometrial cancer with superficial invasion into myometrium (less than half thickness) is as shown in the image, there are no lymph vascular space invasion (LVSI) by tumor on histology. Which of the following stage is appropriate for this woman?
Which of the following is not an epithelial tumor of stomach?
Which of the following is false about inheritance of tumors?

options.label: A
options.text: Although recessive inheritance is most common the diseases are rare.

options.label: B
options.text: Angelman syndrome is transmitted only from mother to children.

options.label: C
options.text: Reduced penetrance leads to skipping of generations in dominant disease.

options.label: D
options.text: Anticipation can reduce the severity of the disease.

questions.correct_answer: D. Anticipation can reduce the severity of the disease.

questions.text: The class switch that occurs in B cells requires which of the following molecules?
Which of the following cells/mediators are arranged in chronological order of appearance in wound healing?

options.label: A
options.text: Neutrophils → macrophages → platelets → blood vessels → fibroblasts

options.label: B
options.text: Platelets → neutrophils → macrophages → fibroblasts → blood vessels

options.label: C
options.text: Platelets → neutrophils → macrophages → blood vessels → fibroblasts

options.label: D
options.text: Neutrophils → Platelets→ macrophages → fibroblasts → blood vessels

questions.correct_answer: C. Platelets → neutrophils → macrophages → blood vessels → fibroblasts

questions.text: A 55-year male alcoholic has had repeated episodes of abdominal pain in the past 6 months, the pain is partially relieved by bending forwards. The USG of abdomen shows multiple cystic areas in omentum and around pancreas. Which of the following has led to this finding?

Warburg effect happens in tumor cell because?

options.label: D
options.text: To conserve sugars for non-energy functions

questions.correct_answer: D. To conserve sugars for non-energy functions

options.label: A
options.text: Presence of Accessory pathway connecting atria and ventricle

options.label: B

options.text: Radiofrequency ablation of Accessory pathway offers cure

questions.text: In high dose dexamethasone test cortisol production will be unchanged in:-

The following are true regarding Interferon Gamma release assays in tuberculosis except

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Specificity of the test is superior to Tuberculin skin test in BCG vaccinated patients

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: A. Antigens from all BCG strains and nontuberculous mycobacteria are present in the assay

questions.correct_answer: A. Difficulty in understanding written text

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibitory neural degeneration localized to nerve cell bodies

questions.text: Which of the following agents causes non inflammatory diarrhea?
In patients with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy maximum mutations are found in which gene:
Giant "a" waves in the jugular vein can occur all of following except:
Most common cause of pleural effusion is

A 24-year-old Primigravida was admitted with fever with chills and right hypochondriac pain. Hemogram revealed WBC count of 25600 with a normal platelet count. Her LFT and RFT were normal. USG revealed the presence of multiple hepatic abscesses. She was started on IV antibiotics. She developed sudden onset palpitations and her Pulse was rapid and irregular. BP was 96/64 mm of Hg and she appeared restless. She was transferred to the ICU and ECG was recorded.

A 20-year-old male presented to the clinic with history of fever with chills for past 2 days. He complained of associated headache and myalgia. The highest recorded temperature at home was 41֯ C and there was no particular pattern. Patient is case of Hereditary Spherocytosis and underwent Splenectomy for the same at 12 years of age since he was transfusion dependant. His vaccination history is complete. On examination he had a Temperature of 40֯ C, P-90/min, BP-100/60mm of Hg. He had pallor and icterus with no lymphadenopathy. Laboratory tests revealed a Hb-7.3gm/dl, WBC-4600, Plt-94000. His Liver function test showed an elevated bilirubin with elevated ALP, SGOT, SGPT. Urine analysis showed haemoglobinuria and proteinuria. Examination of Giemsa-stained thin smear revealed ameboid trophozoites lacking hemozoin deposits. What is the diagnosis?

A 70-year-old female presents with complaints of severe unilateral headache which is worse on supine position. She also reports myalgia, low grade fever and weight loss of 8 kgs in the last 6 months. There is history of Jaw claudication with intermittent diplopia. Following statements about her condition are true EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: She is most probably suffering from a Granulomatous vasculitis.

options.label: B
options.text: Biopsy is likely to reveal oedematous infiltration of the intima, media and adventitia with lymphocytes and macrophages with giant cells.

options.label: C
options.text: The EULAR recommendations allow Doppler study as an alternative to Biopsy in such cases

options.label: D
options.text: The dreaded complication in such cases is blindness which is most commonly due to Anterior ciliary artery involvement leading to A.I.O.N.

questions.correct_answer: D. The dreaded complication in such cases is blindness which is most commonly due to Anterior ciliary artery involvement leading to A.I.O.N.

questions.text: 34-year-old female presented with frequent headaches and bodyache since the past 4-5 months. She appears stressed and accepts that there is work pressure on her to meet deadlines. She also complains of inability to focus on her work. She has disturbed sleep and wakes up tired on majority of the days. Which antibody is most likely associated with her condition?

76 years gentleman came to the clinic for a routine follow-up. He is an obese patient with history of hypertension for 20 years. His BP is controlled on Telmisartan + Hydrochlorthiazide combination. He is non diabetic and takes Atorvastatin for his dyslipidemia. He complains of occasional palpitations and feels tired. He lost his wife a month ago and acknowledged feeling low. ECG was recorded. What is the diagnosis and its probable cause in this case?

options.label: B
options.text: Right bundle branch block – Degenerative HD

options.label: C
options.text: Left bundle branch block – Ischemic heart disease

options.label: D
options.text: Left ventricular hypertrophy – hypertensive heart disease

questions.correct_answer: B. Right bundle branch block – Degenerative HD

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy presents with short stature to the clinic for evaluation. The boy appears weak and complains of bone pains which did no respond to Calcium and D3 supplementation. He has history of reccurent loin pain and was detected to have nephrocalcinosis on USG and started on Citrate supplementation 6 months ago. What is the most likely laboratory abnormality in this case?

Of the following the most sensitive test to differentiate prerenal from intrinsic (renal) types of acute renal failure is
questions.correct_answer: D. The fractional excretion of sodium (FENa)

questions.text: Following statement about Raynaud’s phenomenon are true EXCEPT:

options.label: B
options.text: It follows the skin manifestations in a case of systemic sclerosis

options.label: C
options.text: Palliative treatment with Calcium channel blockers is effective

options.label: D
options.text: Iloprost is approved for its treatment

questions.correct_answer: B. It follows the skin manifestations in a case of systemic sclerosis
